body.content.p: AFP Middle East focus on Tuesday
+ Arab League observers headed for Syria
+ Deadly clashes raise tensions in Egypt
+ First GCC annual summit of Arab Spring

DAMASCUS: An Arab League mission prepares to head to Syria after Damascus said it would allow observers to assess the unrelenting violence, and a Syrian opposition group says foreign troops may soon be needed to stop the bloodshed. (SYRIA-POLITICS-UNREST)

CAIRO: Monitoring tension in Egypt after security forces clashed with protestors demanding an end to military rule for a fourth straight day and the death toll rose to 12, despite strong international criticism of the use of force. (EGYPT-POLITICS-UNREST)
RIYADH: Monarchs of the Gulf Cooperation Council wrap up their first annual summit since the Arab Spring overthrew a raft of regional governments, including key allies. (GULF-SUMMIT)
ANKARA: Palestinian president Mahmud Abbas meets top Turkish officials on the second day of a visit to Turkey. (PALESTINIANS-TURKEY-DIPLOMACY)
BEIRUT: Verdict in the trial of General Fayez Karam on charges of spying for Israel. (LEBANON-ISRAEL-CONFLICT-ESPIONAGE-TRIAL)
CAIRO: Hamas and Fatah meet with all the other Palestinian factions for key talks aimed at thrashing out details of a stalled unity deal. (PALESTINIANS-POLITICS-UNITY-EGYPT)
